svg.text: ML-303 Interface Circuits - Detailed Build Guide
• Cut tracks between IC pins 6-7 and 5-6 (rows D-E, columns 6-7)
• Use 3mm drill bit or track cutting tool
• 6N138: Pins in rows D-E, columns 6-7 (DIP-8 socket recommended)
• 220Ω resistors: R1 at C3-C4, R2 at F3-F4
• +5V: Row A (power rail) • GND: Row I (ground rail)
• MIDI IN: DIN pins 4,5 to resistors • Arduino A4: From pin 6 output
• Cut between IC pins to isolate each pin
• Cut at columns 5-6 and 7-8, rows C-D
• MCP4921: DIP-8 socket at columns 5-8, rows C-D
• Bypass capacitors: 0.1µF near VCC and VSS pins
• CS → Arduino D13 • SCK,SDI → Arduino D11
• Cut between IC pins to prevent unwanted connections
• Cut at input and output connection points
• CD4049UBE: DIP-16 socket spanning rows B-D
• Single supply: VDD = +9V to +18V, VSS = GND
• Dual supply: VDD = +15V, VSS = -15V (compatible with ML-303)
• 3mm drill bit or track cutting tool
• Use IC sockets for all ICs to prevent heat damage
• Keep component leads short to minimize noise
• Test all connections before applying power
• Add bypass capacitors (0.1µF) near all IC power pins
Rows: A-I (horizontal copper tracks) Columns: 1-15 (hole positions)
Track width: Standard stripboard copper width (approx 2mm)
1. Verify all track cuts with continuity tester
2. Check power supply connections before inserting ICs
3. Test with known good signals before connecting to ML-303
